text: Can we please bring back the Custom HTML/HubL module?

that is it.

HubSpot converted the html module to be a marketplace module, the reason being most of the time people used that module it should have been done as a custom module allowing for reusability and a better experience for marketers.
This way you have to choose to want an html module to get one.
It would be cool if the Page field allowed the user to enter an external link and toggle target=“_blank” on that bad boy. Maybe we could set in the editor whether or not they have that ability.

<@U26DA9CQ0> You could do this with a simple text field with a regex validation of a proper url + a boolean to toggle the “_blank” on/off --- Grouped together to display when the user flips a select from “Internal” to “External”
If “Internal” show the HubSpot Page selector
if “external” show the custom group described above

I like the auto-_blank idea!

I’ve set up something similar where the page selector has an override but “Just leave this blank if you want the other option” seems to confuse people. Same with toggles.
I think the confusion stems from labeling / description on that one - If the checkbox says “Open this link in a new page” I think it’s pretty darn clear
Yeah that’s totally clear, it’s more like when I need to make an overriding field. It would be nice if we could make the field help text always visible.

Hi Radu! Sorry to get back to you so late, a lot of us have been out recently on vacation. If you remember which template this was can you send me a link? I'm trying to reproduce the problem but cannot. We know there are some issues with upgrading modules so we want to be sure we're addressing everything.

Hi Pete! Definitely a good thought (we've floated that idea around before), the obstacle there is that there are many existing page fields whose values are page IDs, but in order to have an external link input and a toggle for opening in a new page we'd have to change the data type to an object to contain all that new info. It's not impossible but can get complicated. Even if we leave out the checkbox and made it a single value people would need to potentially change their module code to expect either a page ID or a URL string. Definitely not ruling this out though, I've opened a github issue to discuss this with my team!
